review_title: Hanover Healthcare... a fantastic place to work.
pros: The therapists and nursing staff at the facility are great.  For the most part, everyone gets along and tries to help eachother out.  I was a new grad when I started working at Hanover Healthcare and Rehab Center, and I found that not only occupational therapists, but also the phyiscal therapists were willing to help me learn and have continued to be helpful as I've grown as a therapist.  Everyone there helps eachother out.  Our facility is about to grow, but we are very organized and have a way of working that helps make the day flow even with an increased case load.  It's a faced paced, demanding job that rarely feels boring.  I genually love working here!
cons: As of right now, because of a high demand for therapists, but a small pool to choose from, there's a high case load, and a stress on productivity time.  Sometimes it seems that they don't take into consideration that the more patietns you have, the more paperwork you will have to fill out.

pros: Company gives incentives, bonuses, and many more to employees, also recognize the employees that go above and beyond
cons: High turn around rate with employees

review_title: Advice from Longtime RN:  Look elsewhere first!
pros: Safe and easy commute. Easy parking. Many good co-workers
cons: I worked here for  many  years. My manager was a woman so completely self absorbed that she never missed a photo op or chance to brand an employee's good idea as her own. She promoted perceived loyalty to her over ability, education, and experience every time. Very insecure and controlling, though this was not confined to our department exclusively. Several other managers were also very "difficult."  Some were ok. The CNO is out of touch with reality. She has brought on some of her cronies from MD hospitals where she has worked in the past who are equally poor leaders. The wages are poor. There was no weekend differential and shift differentials were poor. Nurses are floated from unit to unit with little consideration for skill or patient acuity. It can be dangerous at times due to the staffing mix. They prefer young staff who make less money and who will be less likely to challenge authority. Those with opinions or backbones need not apply. They insist wages are "market" competitive. I think they are comparing their wages with Myers Meat Market, maybe?

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Hanover, PA
pros: Clean working environment.  Close to home.  Co-workers are mostly supportive.
cons: Not all, but most nurses and PCA's are too inept to do their job.  Patient care is mediocre at best.  Doctors and nurses view and treat supportive staff as unworthy.

job_title: Director of Nursing in Canton, OH
cons: Most of the long term employees call corporate any time they violate policy and are held accountable.  The nursing staff has admitted to calling state on several occasions when they feel their demands are not being met after several explanations from management why the situation is the way it is. Several nurses do not pass medications according to the 6 rights plus one of medication administration.  Not enough staff training upon hire and through out year.

review_title: It's who you know not what you know that keeps you working here.
pros: Some good employees mostly backstabbers waiting to make themselves look good by capitalizing on others.
cons: If you are in good with Dr Freer then you don't need to worry about what you know or how you do your job.

pros:
Nurses work as a team
Management has recently hired more RNs for border patients
cons:
High stress
So many committees
Reactive vs proactive

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Hanover, PA
cons: Pay is terrible, micromanage, management does not play nice at all. Long hours

pros: self scheduling; 12 hour shifts; some every 3rd weekend positions
cons: cannot transfer to another department until 1 year in current department; not a lot of recognition for off shifts

pros: There are no good reasons to work there.  Management is terrible, treatment of patient's is terrible, it's all about numbers and money.
cons: Management forever putting you down.  It's all about money in their eyes.

job_title: Home Health Aide-STNA in Massillon, OH
pros: None, bad stuff happens all the time
cons: Everything is horrible too much to type
